Subject: Issues in the KPI report
Description: Hi Team, Good day!! As discussed in the call, in the KPI report, it is showing some Domains whose name ends with ".onmicrosoft.com" which are not even onboarded. Can you please let me know why it is showing, and provide me necessary steps on what to do so that it won't be visible on the KPI report. Please find the attachment for your reference. Thanks, Akhil
DevOps_Steps_to_Reproduce__c: Setup a hybrid environment without any exceptions in PingCastle to see if AzureAD tenant shows in the report
What_We_Know__c: Following the client meeting, it became clear that their environment was configured as a hybrid system (both local and Azure AD). Consequently, this setup caused their Azure tenants to appear in the PingCastle report, which confused the client since it was not within the intended scope. I recommended that the client exclude these tenants from the report, as only the local domains are relevant to their scope.
Next_Steps__c: I have recommended that the client exclude these tenants from the report, as only the local domains are relevant to their scope .However, as they are integral to the hybrid environment, it is advisable to follow appropriate measures to reduce the score for those domains as a best practice.
Solution_Comment__c: Advised customer to create exceptions for the AzureAD tenants to avoid getting the low scores. customer requested the ticket to be closed.
Account_Name__c: Eurofins GSC IT Poland Sp. z.o.o.
